intro: Ormenis flahaultii, commonly known as the Flahault's ormenis, is a rare and endemic plant species native to specific regions of southern France. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and typically herbaceous growth habit. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer months. Ormenis flahaultii is adapted to rocky and arid environments, showcasing a high degree of drought tolerance. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species requiring conservation efforts.
